decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly getting out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Archon of Cruelty by using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. It also utilizes Atraxa, Grand Unifier to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to win the game by bringing out these big threats early on and overwhelming the opponent with their power. Additional cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce help protect the combo pieces from being countered, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help dig through the deck to find the necessary pieces.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. Utilizing cards like Eldrazi Temple and Ancient Tomb, the deck aims to accelerate its mana curve to play out big creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and It That Heralds the End early in the game. Cards like Chalice of the Void and The One Ring provide disruption and protection for the Eldrazi creatures, while cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Devourer of Destiny offer additional value and versatility in combat. The deck aims to establish a dominant board presence and close out the game quickly.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to ramp up quickly with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, allowing the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void helps disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Glaring Fleshraker put pressure on the board. The deck also includes utility lands like Wasteland and Maze of Ith to control the opponent's resources. Overall, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with fast, hard-hitting threats while disrupting their strategy.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Thoughtseize, then bring them back onto the battlefield using Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to combo off by reanimating big threats like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes utility creatures like Brazen Borrower and Troll of Khazad-d√ªm to provide additional value and control options in Legacy 1 vs 1 matches.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed to cast Thassa's Oracle and win the game on the spot. The deck utilizes various fast mana acceleration spells like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal, along with Boggart Trawler to help dig through the deck and find the necessary cards. The combo involves using Balustrade Spy to mill your entire library, putting Thassa's Oracle on top of the library, and then sacrificing Boggart Trawler to reanimate Thassa's Oracle for the win. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Pact of Negation and Cabal Therapy to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies.

The deck focuses on using the Doomsday combo to win the game quickly. By using various tutors and draw spells, the player can set up their deck to win with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Lion's Eye Diamond. The deck also includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Thoughtseize to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Street Wraith and Edge of Autumn help to cycle through the deck quickly, while cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal provide the necessary mana to cast the combo pieces efficiently.

The deck aims to assemble the Doomsday combo as quickly and efficiently as possible, using cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Cabal Ritual to generate mana while protecting the combo with Force of Will and Daze. Personal Tutor and Ponder help find the pieces needed for the combo, with Thassa's Oracle as the win condition. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base consists primarily of blue and black lands, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The main idea of this deck is to efficiently utilize artifacts and mana acceleration to power out powerful combos, such as using Mystic Forge to play cards from the top of the library and generate value with Urza's Saga. The inclusion of cards like Grim Monolith and Manifold Key also help generate mana and untap artifacts to keep the combos going. Karn, the Great Creator can also be utilized to shut down opponent's artifacts while furthering your own game plan. Ultimately, the goal is to assemble a winning board state quickly and overwhelm the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish board control and disrupt the opponent's mana base by utilizing aggressive creatures like Magus of the Moon and Broadside Bombardiers. The deck also aims to deal direct damage with cards like Fury and Sundering Eruption, while also having disruption elements like Blood Moon to limit the opponent's options. The inclusion of Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide allows for explosive starts, while cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and The One Ring provide additional utility and power. Overall, this deck is designed to overwhelm the opponent with fast, aggressive plays.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping out powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. By utilizing Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin, the deck can generate mana efficiently to cast its high-cost threats early in the game. The inclusion of cards like It That Heralds the End and Glaring Fleshraker provides a strong aggressive presence on the battlefield, putting pressure on the opponent from the start. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast, powerful creatures and disruptive spells.

The deck revolves around quickly and efficiently milling the opponent's library and then winning the game with Thassa's Oracle's ability to win if your library is empty. It uses a mix of fast mana spells, creature recursion, and disruptive spells to quickly assemble the combo and protect it from disruption. By using a combination of card advantage engines and protective spells, the deck aims to mill the opponent's deck as quickly as possible before winning the game on the spot.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting opponents with counter spells like Daze and Force of Will while using efficient removal like Fatal Push. It also utilizes cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find key cards quickly. The deck aims to control the early game with cards like Baleful Strix and Psychic Frog before transitioning into a more aggressive strategy with cards like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares is a powerful finisher. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' game plan while establishing its own board presence.

The main concept of this Legacy 1 vs 1 Combo - Painter deck is to utilize cards like Grindstone, Painter's Servant, and Painter's tools to quickly mill opponent's library and win the game. The deck focuses on generating advantage using cards that synergize with the main combo pieces, as well as disrupting opponent's strategies using cards like Red Elemental Blast and Pithing Needle. The deck also includes artifact creatures like Goblin Welder and Goblin Engineer to further support the combo and control aspects of the deck.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while deploying threats quickly. It aims to control the board through efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while maintaining card advantage with cards like Brainstorm and Nihil Spellbomb. Delver of Secrets and Murktide Regent provide fast aggressive threats, supported by counter magic like Daze and Force of Will. The deck's land base allows for mana efficiency, utilizing Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana bases. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting opponents, this deck aims to close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on utilizing efficient removal spells and disruptive cards like Hymn to Tourach to control the opponent while deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Nethergoyf to quickly close out the game. The deck also includes card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing the right cards. The mana base is optimized for a mix of red and black spells, with Wasteland included for additional disruption. Overall, this deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control throughout the game to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive tempo plays and disruption to control the board and outmaneuver the opponent. Using powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, along with counters like Force of Will and Daze, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to apply pressure and end the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Reanimate provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategies, creating a versatile and dynamic gameplay experience.
